intro: Microlicia minima var. aristifera, commonly known as the small-leaved microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The plant's ornamental value comes from its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
